# Privacy Policy – RADAR Study Portal

_Last updated: 4th October 2025_

The RADAR Study Portal is operated by a research team at **King’s College London (KCL)**. The Portal supports mobile health research studies by allowing participants to log in, complete questionnaires, and connect devices such as Fitbit. This page explains how your data is handled.

## 1. Who we are

The RADAR Study Portal is managed by King’s College London as part of its research infrastructure. Each individual study using this platform has its **own research team** who act as the **data controller**. KCL provides and maintains the Portal as a **data processor** on their behalf.

For questions about your study data:

- Email your study team (see your participant information sheet)
- Email the Portal team at [radar-base@kcl.ac.uk](mailto:radar-base@kcl.ac.uk)
- Or contact the KCL Data Protection Team at [info-compliance@kcl.ac.uk](mailto:info-compliance@kcl.ac.uk)

## 2. What data we collect

- Name and email address
- Demographic information (such as age or gender)
- Survey and questionnaire responses
- Linked device or app data (e.g., Fitbit, wearable sensors)
- Technical data such as IP address, browser type, and device information
- Cookies (see the study's [Cookies Policy](cookies))

## 3. How we use your data

We use your information to:

- Set up and manage your account
- Display and collect questionnaires
- Connect to external data sources you authorise
- Maintain and secure the Portal
- (If approved) monitor site usage via Google Analytics

## 4. Where and how your data is stored

Your data is stored securely on **Amazon Web Services (AWS)** servers in the **United Kingdom** (or the European Economic Area for EU studies). It is encrypted and kept only for the duration of your study’s data collection period before being securely transferred to your study team.

## 5. Legal basis

We process your data based on your **consent** to participate and, where appropriate, KCL’s **legitimate interests** in securely operating the Portal. Each study provides full details in its own information sheet.

## 6. Your rights

You have rights under UK and EU data protection law to:

- Access a copy of your data
- Ask for corrections or deletion
- Withdraw your consent
- Limit or object to how your data is used

To exercise these rights, contact your study team or [radar-base@kcl.ac.uk](mailto:radar-base@kcl.ac.uk).

## 7. Keeping your data secure

Your information is protected using encryption, secure servers, and strict access controls. Only authorised KCL staff and the relevant research team can access your data.

## 8. Updates to this policy

We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. Any significant changes will be shown here with a new “last updated” date.

## 9. Contact us

**For study questions:** your research team (see your participant information sheet)

**For Portal or data questions:** [radar-base@kcl.ac.uk](mailto:radar-base@kcl.ac.uk)

**For data protection queries:** [info-compliance@kcl.ac.uk](mailto:info-compliance@kcl.ac.uk)
